Holdings.questionTitle: How will off market transactions show up in my holding?
Holdings.answerHtml: Off market transactions will show up in your holdings after it reflects in your demat account. It takes 2 working days after the transaction date to show up (T+2). Please raise a ticket if it has been more than 2 days.

Holdings.questionTitle: When will corporate action reflect in my holdings?
Holdings.answerHtml: It will reflect on the execution date. After the delivery date it will start reflecting in your holdings.

Holdings.questionTitle: Why are some of my shares locked?
Holdings.answerHtml:
Your shares might be locked due to any one of the following reasons: - You may have pledged your shares, hence you are not allowed to sell the order. 

If you are sure this isn't the case, please raise a ticket by pressing the button below.

Holdings.questionTitle: Why do I have to verify holdings with TPIN?
Holdings.answerHtml:
Effective from 18 Feb 2021, you’ll have to enter TPIN and OTP received on your registered mobile number while verifying your holdings before selling. (Validity: 1 day)

To generate a new TPIN, please click on the button below.

You can find your BOID in YOU --> Personal Details (16 digit number)
Holdings.feedback: PIN, T PIN, password to sell, PIN to sell

Intraday Positions.questionTitle: My issue is not listed here.
Intraday Positions.answerText: You can try searching for your issue. Alternatively you can raise a ticket with us. Our Customer Support champs will help you out in no time!

Intraday Positions.questionTitle: What happens if I don't exit my position?
Intraday Positions.answerText:
In intraday trading, each open position should be squared off by 3:10 PM. If it’s a system square-off, there will be a charge of Rs.50 + GST per position. 

Hence, we recommend planning the square-off for your open intraday positions well in advance.

Delivery Positions.questionTitle: What is the difference between realised and unrealised returns?
Delivery Positions.answerHtml:
Realised returns is the return you have made after actually selling your stocks. 
Unrealised return, on the other hand, is the return you can make if you sell your stocks.

Before Applying.questionTitle: Can I apply for an IPO on multiple platforms?
Before Applying.answerText: You can place 1 application per PAN card regardless of which platforms you use.
Before Applying.feedback: many IPO, two IPO, IPO through different platform

Before Applying.answerText:
Here are the steps to apply for IPO: 

 1. Press the 'INVEST IN IPO' button below.
 2. You will see the list of open IPOs. Press the 'APPLY' button beside the IPO name you want to apply for. 
 3. In the box on the right side, enter the number of shares you want to apply for. 
 4. Press the 'CONTINUE' button.
 5. Enter your UPI ID. You will get this from your UPI app (Google Pay, PhonePe, etc). 
 6. Press the 'CONTINUE' button.
 7. You will be able to see a timeline of your IPO application process and the tentative allotment date.
 8. Within 24 hours, you will get a UPI mandate request on your UPI app. Approve it.  
 
Done!

Note: The UPI mandate request may come instantly or may take up to 24 hours to come.
Before Applying.feedback: subscribe to ipo, new ipo, apply ipo

Before Applying.questionTitle: What is lot size and cutoff price in an IPO?
Before Applying.answerText:
It is the minimum number of shares that an investor has to apply for. This is known as the IPO bid lot or market lot size or minimum order quantity. 
 
 Example: IPO of company ABC has a market lot size of 100 shares. So an investor can apply for 100 shares, or 200 shares, or 300 shares, and so on.

The cutoff price is the maximum price for a particular IPO. Eg. price range for ABC company's IPO is Rs 100-105 then Rs 105 is the cutoff price.

Intraday Profit.questionTitle: I have not received my profit for the day.
Intraday Profit.answerText: The intraday buy-sell profit amount has been blocked as per SEBI regulations, which will be released on the next market session (T+1) after the market closes.

Intraday Profit.questionTitle: When will I receive my profits for the day?
Intraday Profit.answerText: If you have taken any positions today and squared off in the same day, then your profit amount will get unblocked on the next market session (T+1) after market closes.

Intraday Profit.questionTitle: Why is my intraday profit amount blocked?
Intraday Profit.answerText: The intraday buy-sell profit amount has been blocked as per SEBI regulations, which will be released on the next market session (T+1) after the market closes.

Margin.questionTitle: What are intraday square off charges?
Margin.answerText:
In intraday trading, each open position should be squared off by 3:10 PM. 

If it’s an auto square-off, there will be a charge of Rs.50 + GST per position. 

Hence, we recommend planning the square-off for your open intraday positions well in advance.
Margin.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, GST, maintenance charges, intraday charges, delivery charges, dp charges, square off charges, account opening charges, turnover, stamp duty,

Margin.questionTitle: What are DP charges (depository participant charges)
Margin.answerText:
DP charges or Depository Participant charges are charged by the depository (CDSL). 

DP charges when buying: Rs 0. 

DP charges when selling: Rs 13.5 + GST per ISIN (company stock or ETF) per day, regardless of quantity sold.
Margin.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, GST, maintenance charges, intraday charges, delivery charges, dp charges, square off charges, account opening charges, turnover, stamp duty,

Margin.answerHtml:
Margin is the money you borrow from Groww (broker) to trade in stocks. 
With the margin feature on Groww, you are able to buy stocks for as low as 15% of the total value of the stock.
Margin.feedback: grow, platform, website, site, shares, equity, holdings

Margin.questionTitle: What is stocks margin used in Groww Balance?
Margin.answerHtml:
This is the margin that you have already used for your trading.

After settlement, you will be able to see this in the evening as "Paid for Stock" or " Received from Stock".

Regulatory Charges.answerHtml: The rate of GST applicable is 18% of the amount wherever applicable.
Regulatory Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, GST, maintenance charges, intraday charges, delivery charges, dp charges, square off charges, account opening charges, turnover, stamp duty,

Regulatory Charges.questionTitle: What are transaction charges by exchange?
Regulatory Charges.answerHtml: Transaction charges are charges applicable for trading on the exchanges. BSE: 0.003% of ordar amount NSE: 0.00325% of order amount. It is applicable for both buy and sell orders.
Regulatory Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, GST, maintenance charges, intraday charges, delivery charges, dp charges, square off charges, account opening charges, turnover, stamp duty,

Regulatory Charges.answerHtml: For regulating the market, SEBI charges 0.00005% of the turnover.
Regulatory Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, SEBI charges

Regulatory Charges.answerHtml: It is charged by the government for the contract note, applicable on buy orders only. For equity delivery: 0.015% For equity intraday: 0.003%
Regulatory Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, stamp duty,

Regulatory Charges.answerHtml:
STT stands for Securities Transaction Tax. It is charged by the government when you transact on the exchanges.

For equity delivery: 0.1% of order amount
For equity intraday: 0.025% of order amount
Regulatory Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, securities transaction tax

Account Charges.answerHtml:
This is Rs 0 on Groww. 

Most platforms charge an annual maintenance charge (AMC) for the demat account. On Groww, we do not have any AMC.
Account Charges.feedback: charges, prices, stocks charges, transaction charges, GST, maintenance charges, intraday charges, delivery charges, dp charges, square off charges, account opening charges, turnover, stamp duty,

Account Charges.answerHtml:
Currently, opening a stocks account is completely free on Groww.

This may change in the near future. However, any change in account opening charge will be notified to all our users before implementing that update.

Other.questionTitle: Is there any rule for limit price of an order?
Other.answerHtml: As per exchange guidelines, you can buy or sell a stock within a certain range. This range is displayed to you when you're placing a buy or sell limit order.

Other.questionTitle: When will I get the money after selling stocks?
Other.answerHtml: As per SEBI guidelines, the money will get credited to your Groww Balance 2 working days after your transaction (T+2 days).
